DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Lymphoid Cell Positive Finding Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the percentage of lymphoid cells in a tissue (bone marrow) specimen. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Review Event Parameter Object Lymphocyte Percentage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Something that happens at a given place and time.:Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance._White blood cells formed in the body's lymphoid tissue. The nucleus is round or ovoid with coarse, irregularly clumped chromatin while the cytoplasm is typically pale blue with azurophilic (if any) granules. Most lymphocytes can be classified as either T or B (with subpopulations of each); those with characteristics of neither major class are called null cells. (MSH2001):A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Review Event Parameter Object
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Something that happens at a given place and time.:Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance.

Property.preferredDefinition: White blood cells formed in the body's lymphoid tissue. The nucleus is round or ovoid with coarse, irregularly clumped chromatin while the cytoplasm is typically pale blue with azurophilic (if any) granules. Most lymphocytes can be classified as either T or B (with subpopulations of each); those with characteristics of neither major class are called null cells. (MSH2001):A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: White blood cells formed in the body's lymphoid tissue. The nucleus is round or ovoid with coarse, irregularly clumped chromatin while the cytoplasm is typically pale blue with azurophilic (if any) granules. Most lymphocytes can be classified as either T or B (with subpopulations of each); those with characteristics of neither major class are called null cells.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center adoption of C3D
